{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2988724,"name":"Eric Bergquist","username":"kitare102","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kitare102/{size}/212327_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T01:15:46.497Z","cooked":"

Hi all,

Looks like many people are having trouble accurately gauging the Cargo pressure since it’s so low. Can people leave links to pumps and pressure gauges with the right fittings to effectively work with them?

Thanks!
Eric

What is the full-scale pressure reading on the gauge? Preferably, the target pressure is some significant fraction of the full-scale.

I have this on order. Range 0-12 PSI with a digital readout that is supposedly accurate to .1 PSI. Also has the ability to set a target pressure, so it stops filling at that point.

amazon.com

Nice

Next question is going to be how consistent are the balls over time? I seem to remember the cargo from Deep Space stretching over time. At least we had a go-no-go jig for those.

Wonder what the size range will be for these when a new ball is introduced to the field compared to beginning of the season balls that are two months old…

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T14:21:36.005Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":222,"readers_count":221,"score":59.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"Fields","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":7968,"username":"Jon_Stratis","name":"Jon Stratis","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jon_stratis/{size}/2663_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23888,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Charge Onward"},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/5","custom_user_title":"Charge Onward","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988994,"name":"Jim Forbes","username":"MrForbes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrforbes/{size}/165505_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T14:27:19.751Z","cooked":"
Fields:

Wonder what the size range will be for these when a new ball is introduced to the field compared to beginning of the season balls that are two months old…

It’s these questions that make me want to build a robot that doesn’t really care how big the balls are, or how much they’re inflated…

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T14:27:19.751Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":205,"readers_count":204,"score":56.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/6","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2988998,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T14:32:03.274Z","cooked":"

I’m going to guess there will be a good chance for the cargo this year to vary in size a fair bit. The manual only mentions that the cargo will be inflated to 3.5 PSI (would be great to have a listed tolerance for pressure we should be working too. ie, ± 1 psi). Nothing about regulating the overall OD’s of them. In fact, the manual goes as far as to say that these game pieces have extremely poor (rather, no) tolerancing

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T14:32:03.274Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":188,"readers_count":187,"score":42.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":23888,"username":"Fields","name":"Fields","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fields/{size}/7873_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/7","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2989046,"name":"MARS_James","username":"MARS_James","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mars_james/{size}/4606_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T15:19:29.850Z","cooked":"

The manual says they are 9.5 inches is diameter,

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T15:19:29.850Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":163,"readers_count":162,"score":37.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"MARS_James","primary_group_name":"FUN","flair_name":"FUN","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/3/5/3523e759b0af37a7757142a8b2aa79b31f1a47c4.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":60,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19532,"username":"cad321","name":"Brian Wagg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13405,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2989049,"name":"Jim Forbes","username":"MrForbes","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrforbes/{size}/165505_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T15:20:58.276Z","cooked":"

It appears to me that the material the Cargo is made from this year, is not nearly as elastic as the 2019 Cargo. Air pressure does not significantly affect size. It does affect “bounciness”, though.

Play with it, see what you find.

Also, they’re not really round…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T15:21:41.747Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"Jim Forbes","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6260,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/9","custom_user_title":"Jim Forbes 1726 Mechanical Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2989086,"name":"Brian Wagg","username":"cad321","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/c57346/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-11T15:50:11.356Z","cooked":"

Touche, I guess I was making an assumption (something you should never do while reading the manual, I know) that because they didn’t specify a way to determine if a piece of cargo is to size (thinking 2019 cargo go-no-go gauges), that they must just be measuring psi.

A good question for the QA I guess would be how field personnel will determine if cargo is “to spec” or not. While the manual says that there are no tight tolerances for these balls, I would imagine a completely flat/popped cargo would be deemed not to spec (I really hope at least). The field tour videos (or was it the kickoff broadcast?) clearly addressed how they will address the wear and tear on the surfaces of the cargo, but not size/pressure. At what point will field reset or refs look at a ball and go, that’s under filled, too small, too large or over pressure?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-11T15:50:11.356Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":152,"readers_count":151,"score":55.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"Brian Wagg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13405,"username":"MARS_James","name":"MARS_James","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mars_james/{size}/4606_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19532,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Brian Wagg"},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/10","custom_user_title":"Brian Wagg","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2991033,"name":"Jared Hasen-Klein","username":"jaredhk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jaredhk/{size}/248125_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T20:29:14.970Z","cooked":"

https://soccer.epicsports.com/prod/14762/champion-sports-pressure-gauge.html

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2022-01-13T20:29:14.970Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":399595,"topic_slug":"cargo-pump-and-gauge-links","display_username":"Jared Hasen-Klein","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://soccer.epicsports.com/prod/14762/champion-sports-pressure-gauge.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":42},{"url":"https://frc-qa.firstinspires.org/qa/6","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FIRST FRC Q&A System","clicks":13}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":24866,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/cargo-pump-and-gauge-links/399595/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2997084,"name":"Mentor FRC 2992, FTC 25619, past FTC 10337, FTC 14374","username":"msonnier","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msonnier/{size}/199751_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-23T22:49:51.256Z","cooked":"

We ordered one of these gauges from Epic Sports and it came in yesterday. Our unit showed up “broken” with a massive air leak. Basically the front “glass” of the air gauge popped off the first time we tried to use it. Very poorly made instrument. I hope the field staff gets some “good ones” to use…
